DataElement.preferredName: Beck Depression Inventory Seven Past Day Decision Making True Score Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric response to a questionnaire item asking an individual about statements about making decisions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Beck Depression Inventory Seven Past Day Decision Making True Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A twenty-one question survey completed by a patient, with each answer scored on a scale of 0 to 3, designed to measure presence of depression._A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.:Before the present time.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._The process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A twenty-one question survey completed by a patient, with each answer scored on a scale of 0 to 3, designed to measure presence of depression.

Concepts.definition: A twenty-one question survey completed by a patient, with each answer scored on a scale of 0 to 3, designed to measure presence of depression.

Property.preferredName: Seven Past Day Decision Making Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.:Past; before the present time.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.       :The process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Beck Depression Inventory Decision Making Scale

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I have trouble making any decisions.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: I have trouble making any decisions.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I have much greater difficulty in making decisions than I used to.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: I have much greater difficulty in making decisions than I used to.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I find it more difficult to make decisions than usual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: I find it more difficult to make decisions than usual.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I make decisions about as well as ever.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: I make decisions about as well as ever.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
